intro: Linociera sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran linociera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Sumatra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
